intro: Pyrrocoma crocea var. genuflexa, commonly known as the bent-flower pyrrocoma, is a rare flowering plant characterized by its unique, drooping inflorescence. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is native to specific regions of South America. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact cluster. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
